meanings.sent1: The ancient artifact was a unicum in the museum's collection.
meanings.sent2: Each snowflake is a unicum, with no two being exactly alike.
meanings.sent3: The unicum of the situation was the unexpected appearance of a rainbow during the storm.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was a unicum, filling the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The unicum of the rare flower's bloom captivated all who saw it.

meanings.definition: A unique or exceptional person or thing
meanings.sent1: The talented artist was a unicum in the art world.
meanings.sent2: The unicum of the team, she always came up with creative solutions to problems.
meanings.sent3: His unicum status as the only one who could solve the puzzle made him popular at the party.
meanings.sent4: She was a unicum in her ability to bring people together with her kindness.
meanings.sent5: The unicum of the rare gem's color made it highly sought after by collectors.
